text: A shrimp's heart is located in its head. Turtles can breathe through their butts, a process called "cloacal respiration." Elephants are the only animals that can't jump, but they can sleep standing up. Wombats are the only animals whose poop is cube-shaped, and scientists believe this helps mark their territory. Kangaroos can't walk backward due to their muscular tails. The word "astronaut" comes from the Greek words for "star" and "sailor," meaning "star sailor." There are more fake flamingos in the world than real ones! The longest hiccuping spree lasted for 68 years, by Charles Osborne. Ducks' quacks don't echo, and no one knows why. You can hear a blue whale's heartbeat from over 2 miles away.
